pt.ulisboa.tecnico.sdis.ws.uddi

Class UDDINaming

  • java.lang.Object
    • pt.ulisboa.tecnico.sdis.ws.uddi.UDDINaming

  • public class UDDINaming
extends Object
    This class defines simple methods to bind UDDI organizations to URL addresses: list, lookup, unbind, bind, rebind. It is inspired by the java.rmi.Naming class.

    To achieve greater control of the underlying registry, the JAX-R API should be used instead.

    Author:
    Miguel Pardal

    • Constructor Detail

      • UDDINaming

        public UDDINaming(String uddiURL)
           throws UDDINamingException
        Creates an UDDI client configured to access the specified URL. The connection to the server is managed automatically (auto-connect option is enabled).
        Parameters:
        uddiURL - URL of UDDI server to use
        Throws:
        UDDINamingException - if constructor fails

      • UDDINaming

        public UDDINaming(String uddiURL,
                  boolean autoConnect)
           throws UDDINamingException
        Creates an UDDI client configured to access the specified URL and with the specified auto-connect option.
        Parameters:
        uddiURL - URL of UDDI server to use
        autoConnect - option to connect automatically to UDDI server when an action is requested
        Throws:
        UDDINamingException - if constructor fails

      • listRecords

        public Collection<UDDIRecord> listRecords(String orgName)
                                   throws UDDINamingException
        Returns a collection of records bound to the name. The provided name can include wild-card characters - % or ? - to match multiple records.
        Parameters:
        orgName - Name of organization (may contain pattern)
        Returns:
        Collection of records matching provided organization name
        Throws:
        UDDINamingException - if list fails

      • list

        public Collection<String> list(String orgName)
                        throws UDDINamingException
        Returns a collection of URLs bound to the name. The provided name can include wild-card characters - % or ? - to match multiple records.
        Parameters:
        orgName - Name of organization (may contain pattern)
        Returns:
        Collection of URLs belonging to organizations that match the provided organization name
        Throws:
        UDDINamingException - if list fails

      • lookupRecord

        public UDDIRecord lookupRecord(String orgName)
                        throws UDDINamingException
        Returns the first record associated with the specified name.
        Parameters:
        orgName - Name of organization (may contain pattern)
        Returns:
        First record associated with name or null
        Throws:
        UDDINamingException - if lookup fails

      • lookup

        public String lookup(String orgName)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        First URL associated with name or null
        Throws:
        UDDINamingException - if lookup fails

        public void bind(String orgName,
                 String url)

        Binds the specified name to a URL.
        Parameters:
        orgName - Name of organization
        url - Service URL to register
        Throws:
        UDDINamingException - if bind fails

        public void bind(UDDIRecord record)

        Throws:
        UDDINamingException - if bind fails

      • rebind

        public void rebind(String orgName,
                   String url)
            throws UDDINamingException
        Rebinds the specified name to a new URL. Existing record is overwritten.
        Parameters:
        orgName - Name of organization
        url - Service URL to register
        Throws:
        UDDINamingException - if rebind fails

      • rebind

        public void rebind(UDDIRecord record)
            throws UDDINamingException
        Rebinds the specified record containing a name and a new URL. Existing record is overwritten.
        Parameters:
        record - Record to register
        Throws:
        UDDINamingException - if rebind fails
